meanings.sent1: The doctor told the couple that the medicine could help them get impregnated.
meanings.sent2: The young mare was impregnated by the strong stallion in the field.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that the soil was so fertile, even the seeds seemed impregnated with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was impregnated with the idea of starting her own business.
meanings.sent5: The rain impregnated the dry earth, bringing life to the parched land.

meanings.sent1: The sponge was impregnated with soapy water for cleaning the dishes.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was impregnated with waterproofing material to protect it from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret sauce recipe was impregnated with flavors that made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The forest air was impregnated with the scent of pine and damp earth.
meanings.sent5: The music was impregnated with emotion, moving the audience to tears.

meanings.sent1: The aroma of freshly baked bread impregnated the entire house.
meanings.sent2: The artist's passion was impregnated in every stroke of the brush.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of children impregnated the park with joy and liveliness.
meanings.sent4: His words were impregnated with sincerity, touching the hearts of all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The memories of her childhood impregnated her dreams, bringing back vivid images of the past.
